DESCRIPTION
This man page documents briefly the &dhpackage; and &dhngpackage; commands.
The auditory model simulator (&dhucpackage;) allows users to design, run and evaluate auditory models. It is supported by the extensive collection of published and new models supplied by the development system for auditory modelling (DSAM) library. The facilities and interface of this package have many features in common with those of other applications produced using the DSAM library.
&dhpackage; employs a graphical user interface, whereas &dhngpackage; is the command-line version.
For a more detailed manual please see the &datadir;/&dhpackage;/HelpFiles/&dhucpackage;Help.pdf document.
OPTIONS
The program follows the usual GNU command line syntax, with options starting with a dash (`-'). A summary of options is included below. For a complete description, see the
info 1 files.
-d <state>
Diagnostic mode: off, screen or a file name.
-I int
User server ID int when running in server mode..
-l list
Produce lists from the simulation script:
parameters
produce a list of the simulation and all all of its parameters and settings. With the heading lines removed, this output can be used as a simulation parameter file (SPF).
cfinfo
produce a list of the centre frequency information for the first basilar membrane process module found in the simulation.
-P <file name>
Read the main application parameters from this file (obsolete).
-s <file name>
Simulation file to use (.spf, .sim or .xml).
-S
Run application in server mode.
-r int
No. of simulation runs (obsolete).
-v
Show program version.
FILES
&datadir;/&dhpackage;/DEFAULT/*
Example simulations such as thauditory image model AIM, etc. that can be run by &dhpackage;.
&datadir;/&dhpackage;/HelpFiles/*
Contains the more detailed manual, &dhucpackage;Help.pdf.
&datadir;/&dhpackage;/Tutorials/*
Contains tutorials on how to use &dhpackage; including the example simulation scripts.

…
none used at present.
DIAGNOSTICS
&dhpackage; issues verbose diagnostics on stderr.
&dhpackage; provides some return codes, that can be used in scripts:
Code Diagnostic
0 Program exited successfully.
1 Program exited unsuccessfully.
BUGS
To report a bug please e-mail the author. Be sure to include error diagnostic listings, a copy of the simulation script (in SPF form if possible) and a description of the platform, e.g. Windows Vista, Ubuntu 11.04, etc..
The online help has not been implemented at present. A PDF help document is included with the installation and described above.
